jobs.title: Color Management Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

About the Role

We are seeking a Color Management Lead to be the single-threaded owner of color at Dandy. In this role, you will architect and own the entire color management system for our prosthetic workflows—covering everything from scientific modeling and measurement through to production-scale implementation and quality control.

You will be responsible for establishing a robust color management framework that connects ink formulation, ceramic substrates, print hardware, software calibration, and production QC. As both a technical authority and cross-functional leader, you’ll ensure that color accuracy, consistency, and scalability become embedded across R&D and operations.

What You’ll Do

Develop and Own Color Management Systems

  • Architect the end-to-end color management workflow for ceramic inkjet printing on zirconia and other dental ceramics.

  • Design and maintain color calibration pipelines—from device characterization (printers, spectrophotometers, imaging systems) to color transforms and ICC-like profiles.

  • Translate dental shade systems (Vita Classical, Vita 3D-Master, Noritake CZR) into digital color spaces and ensure faithful reproduction in final restorations.

  • Build predictive models for how inks behave after firing (taking into account organics burnoff, sintering shrinkage, and glaze interactions).

Measurement and Characterization

  • Establish standardized measurement protocols using spectrophotometry, hyperspectral imaging, and digital microscopy.

  • Create and maintain master reference libraries for shades, translucency, and surface finish.

  • Quantify color difference tolerances (ΔE, ΔE00) appropriate for dental applications and implement statistical QC limits.

  • Characterize how substrates (zirconia, glass-ceramic, polymers) and processing conditions influence final appearance.

R&D and Process Integration

  • Partner with ink formulation chemists to ensure pigments, dispersions, and solvents are optimized for color fidelity.

  • Collaborate with hardware engineers to integrate color calibration into printhead design, droplet control, and deposition strategies.

  • Work closely with ceramic process engineers to ensure firing programs yield stable, reproducible colors across furnaces and production runs.

  • Lead experimental design (DoE) for color R&D projects, documenting learnings in ways that transfer to scalable production.

Production Quality and Scaling

  • Define and roll out incoming QC standards for pigments, inks, and ceramic blanks to ensure batch-to-batch color stability.

  • Develop real-time monitoring and corrective systems for production, flagging deviations before they reach the patient.

  • Build feedback loops between R&D and manufacturing so color data continuously improves system performance.

  • Train production teams on color measurement protocols, equipment use, and acceptance criteria.

Cross-Functional Leadership

  • Serve as the internal subject matter expert for all topics related to color, interfacing with executives, clinicians, and external partners.

  • Communicate complex color science concepts in clear, actionable ways to non-specialists.

  • Represent Dandy in conversations with material suppliers, shade guide manufacturers, and dental educators.

  • Build an internal knowledge base to scale color expertise across the organization.

What We’re Looking For

  • Education: PhD or MS in Color Science, Applied Physics, Materials Science, Imaging Science, or related field.

  • Experience: 3–7+ years of hands-on work in color management systems, ideally in ceramics, inks, coatings, imaging, or advanced printing.

  • Technical Expertise:

    • Deep knowledge of colorimetry, color appearance models (CIE Lab*, CIECAM02, CAM16), and device profiling.

    • Proficiency in building and validating color transforms, ICC profiles, or equivalent systems.

    • Practical experience with spectrophotometers, imaging colorimeters, and shade-matching devices.

    • Familiarity with ceramic systems, firing dynamics, or inkjet processes strongly preferred.

  • Industry Insight:

    • Understanding of dental shade standards (Vita, Noritake, 3D-Master) highly desirable.

    • Experience working with pigment/ink formulation and knowledge of how substrates affect final color.

  • Software & Tools:

    • Strong computational background (Python, MATLAB, or R) for modeling and data analysis.

    • Experience with color management software such as ProfileMaker, BabelColor, X-Rite tools.

  • Mindset:

    • Comfortable operating as the single-threaded owner of a mission-critical function.

    • Able to switch between strategic system-building and hands-on lab experimentation.

    • Strong communicator who can bridge science, engineering, and production.

Why Join Us

At Dandy, we are reimagining the dental lab from the ground up—bringing together automation, software, and advanced materials to create the future of prosthetics manufacturing. Color is the final frontier in making restorations indistinguishable from natural teeth, and you will be the architect of our solution.

Req ID: J-699

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. If you require any accommodations for your interview or have any questions beforehand, rest assured that we will do everything we can to meet your needs. Visit Dandy Careers for more!

jobs.title: Manager of Payroll and Benefits
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

About the Role

Dandy is hiring a Manager of Payroll & Benefits to serve as our in-house payroll subject matter expert (SME) and own the strategy and execution of our U.S. payroll and benefits programs. This is a critical role within the People Operations team, responsible for delivering compliant, accurate, and employee-friendly payroll and benefits experiences at scale.

In the immediate term, you’ll lead all aspects of domestic payroll operations—owning systems, compliance, and process optimization—while managing U.S. employee benefits administration and strategy. As Dandy continues to expand globally, the scope of this role will grow to include ownership of international payroll and benefits—giving you the opportunity to build scalable, compliant, and locally relevant programs in new markets.

This is an ideal opportunity for a seasoned payroll professional who thrives on ownership, precision, and continuous improvement, and is ready to take on a global mandate as part of a high-growth team.

What You'll Do

  • Own U.S. payroll strategy and compliance, overseeing accurate and timely processing while managing a direct report responsible for day-to-day execution.

  • Act as Dandy’s payroll SME, with full fluency in systems, processes, and regulations—able to step in directly when needed and guide decision-making at all levels.

  • Develop and document standard operating procedures to drive payroll accuracy, transparency, and business continuity.

  • Administer and evolve U.S. benefits programs—including health, retirement, and wellness—owning vendor relationships, open enrollment, and long-term strategy.

  • Lead the build and launch of international payroll and benefits programs in new markets (e.g., Brazil, U.K., Canada), including vendor selection, systems setup, and compliance.

  • Lead cross-functional partnership with Legal, Finance, and HR to ensure alignment, data accuracy, and compliance across payroll and benefits.

  • Serve as the escalation point for complex payroll and benefits issues, ensuring a seamless and high-quality employee experience.

What We're Looking For

  • 6+ years of full-cycle U.S. payroll experience, including multi-state complexity, systems ownership, and compliance leadership.

  • Proven track record acting as a payroll SME within an organization—advising leadership and resolving complex issues.

  • Experience with payroll platforms such as Paylocity, ADP, or UKG; strong systems fluency and problem-solving skills.

  • 2+ years of experience managing employee benefits programs, including vendor/broker management and open enrollment.

  • Knowledge of payroll and benefits compliance requirements (e.g., IRS, DOL, ERISA, ACA, COBRA).

  • Demonstrated success building scalable payroll processes, documentation, and internal controls.

  • Ability to quickly learn and own complex systems and regulations, with a strong eye for detail and accuracy.

  • Excellent communication and project management skills with the ability to distill and explain complex topics to a range of stakeholders.

  • A process and solutions-oriented mindset, with a bias for ownership and execution.

  • Eagerness to take on international scope and grow with the company as our footprint expands.

Bonus Points For

  • Prior experience administering payroll through UKG.

  • Experience launching international payroll and benefits in markets like Canada, the U.K., or Latin America.

  • Familiarity with global payroll vendors and compliance requirements.

  • Prior experience supporting HR/Finance operations during international expansion.

  • Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) or CEBS (Certified Employee Benefit Specialist).

  • Experience administering equity compensation through payroll and benefits lenses.

The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Dandy is $126,550 - $149,000 plus equity. Actual compensation is based on a number of factors including, but not limited to the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience.

Req ID: J-573

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. If you require any accommodations for your interview or have any questions beforehand, rest assured that we will do everything we can to meet your needs. Visit Dandy Careers for more!

jobs.title: Account Executive Manager (NY)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

About the Role

Dandy is hiring a dynamic, high energy, and process-driven, sales manager to join our rapidly growing venture-backed company. As a leader on our commercial sales team, you’ll play a pivotal role in driving revenue growth and shaping the future of our GTM strategy. In this role, you’ll lead a team of ambitious Account Executives, guiding and coaching them to ensure the team exceeds quota. Joining Dandy means becoming part of a rapidly growing, high performance team that takes pride in driving success and shaping the future of our industry. This team continues to set the bar high and is energized by the incredible opportunities ahead


What You'll Do

  • Lead and inspire a group of 8-10 high performing Dandy Account Executives to consistently exceed their goals

  • Collaborate with senior leadership to set and drive a high bar of performance for the team to ensure team has what they need to deliver at their best

  • Be a hands-on coach and develop the team on a continuous basis. This includes but is not limited to:

    • Holding 1 on 1 weekly touch bases to ensure team members are always at 110%

    • Coaching to the individual rep and their specific skill set

    • Conducting live call reviews weekly to identify and iterate on key focus areas

    • Lead by example, occasionally rolling up your sleeves and jumping on calls to demonstrate best practices

    • Conducting weekly pipeline reviews and training sessions to optimize performance

    • Lead weekly team meetings to outline objectives and guidance on ongoing/upcoming initiatives and keep the team feeling motivated and excited

  • Manage escalations, help reps navigate challenging deals, and participate directly in all aspects of the sales cycle to deliver a great outcome for the business and the customer

  • Be an expert in product and process to unblock team members as needed to ensure they can focus on successful selling

  • Operate with an ownership mentality - be proactive when you recognize an opportunity and tackle it to make yourself and Dandy a better place for all


What We're Looking For

  • 5+ years of quota carrying experience

  • 2+ years sales management experience, managing at least 5+ sales reps

  • Proven record of success in a high velocity/high volume sales environment

  • Comfort in a fast-paced start-up environment. Must be low ego and have comfort with ambiguity and change

  • Experience in motivating a team to fill their calendar with outbound prospecting when needed

  • Must be intellectually curious - dentistry is complex, you must be committed to taking the time to continuously educate yourself on our customer’s industry


Bonus Points For

  • You’ve sold to SMB customers particularly in an antiquated industry

  • Excellent time management and organizational skills

  • Strong knowledge of Salesforce and other relevant parts of Sales tech stack such as Gong

Req ID: J-27

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. If you require any accommodations for your interview or have any questions beforehand, rest assured that we will do everything we can to meet your needs. Visit Dandy Careers for more!

   - Conducting live call reviews weekly to identify and iterate on key focus areas
   
   - Lead by example, occasionally rolling up your sleeves and jumping on calls to demonstrate best practices
   
   - Conducting weekly pipeline reviews and training sessions to optimize performance
   
   - Lead weekly team meetings to outline objectives and guidance on ongoing/upcoming initiatives and keep the team feeling motivated and excited

 - Manage escalations, help reps navigate challenging deals, and participate directly in all aspects of the sales cycle to deliver a great outcome for the business and the customer

 - Be an expert in product and process to unblock team members as needed to ensure they can focus on successful selling

 - Operate with an ownership mentality - be proactive when you recognize an opportunity and tackle it to make yourself and Dandy a better place for all


What We're Looking For

 - 5+ years of quota carrying experience

 - 2+ years sales management experience, managing at least 5+ sales reps

 - Proven record of success in a high velocity/high volume sales environment

 - Comfort in a fast-paced start-up environment. Must be low ego and have comfort with ambiguity and change

 - Experience in motivating a team to fill their calendar with outbound prospecting when needed

 - Must be intellectually curious - dentistry is complex, you must be committed to taking the time to continuously educate yourself on our customer’s industry


Bonus Points For

 - You’ve sold to SMB customers particularly in an antiquated industry

 - Excellent time management and organizational skills

 - Strong knowledge of Salesforce and other relevant parts of Sales tech stack such as Gong

Req ID: J-27

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

jobs.title: Senior Director Product Management, Revenue
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

Dandy's key differentiator is deep tech innovation and groundbreaking product development. We are redefining how high-volume, completely-custom restorative products are designed and manufactured, setting a new standard in the industry with superior quality and unmatched turnaround times while reducing costs through advanced AI/ML-native automation and cutting-edge robotics.

Our advanced digital platforms, intelligent manufacturing systems, and AI-powered design tools deliver outstanding value to dentists and their patients, enabling superior clinical outcomes, improved practice efficiency, and enhanced patient satisfaction. By seamlessly integrating machine learning throughout our entire workflow—from automated design optimization to robotic manufacturing precision—we're not just modernizing dental labs, we're revolutionizing them. At Dandy, we don't just serve practices—we make them more profitable, more efficient, and more successful.

About the Role

This is a visionary leadership role focused on building technology solutions that directly drive revenue growth and profitability for our dental practice customers. You will own the strategy and execution of cutting-edge features that leverage AI/ML, CAD, and advanced technologies to transform how practices operate and grow their business.

As the Senior Director for Practice Advanced Technology, you will be responsible for developing and delivering technology solutions that make every practice that partners with Dandy more successful. This includes pioneering capabilities in practice engagement tools, direct-to-patient communication systems, and AI/ML-native treatment simulation platforms.

This role represents a unique opportunity to shape the future of dental practice technology and directly impact the success of thousands of dental practices worldwide.

What You'll Do

  • Define and execute the vision, strategy, and roadmap for Practice Advanced Technology solutions that measurably increase practice revenue and profitability

  • Drive the creation of intelligent practice engagement tools that optimize workflow efficiency and patient throughput

  • Architect direct-to-patient communication platforms that improve case acceptance rates and strengthen patient relationships

  • Pioneer AI/ML-native treatment simulation capabilities that enhance patient understanding and treatment plan acceptance

  • Work closely with full-stack engineering, ML/AI, CAD, and design teams to deliver scalable, high-performance technology solutions

  • Develop deep expertise in dental practice operations, revenue drivers, and patient journey optimization to inform product decisions

  • Partner with the executive team to establish success metrics that directly correlate with practice revenue growth and customer retention

  • Conduct extensive customer discovery with practice owners, office managers, and clinical teams to understand pain points and opportunities

  • Build compelling business cases demonstrating ROI for practices and articulating the value proposition of advanced technology adoption

  • Lead cross-functional initiatives that span multiple engineering disciplines and require coordination across complex technical systems

  • Champion data-driven decision making by establishing measurement frameworks and success criteria for all technology initiatives

  • Communicate product vision, progress, and impact to stakeholders at all levels through clear reporting and compelling demonstrations

What We're Looking For

  • 12+ years of product management experience, with at least 7 years in senior leadership roles driving complex, multi-disciplinary product strategies

  • Proven track record of building and launching technology products that directly drive measurable business outcomes for customers

  • Deep technical fluency across full-stack development, machine learning/AI systems, and CAD technologies with ability to guide technical architecture decisions

  • Exceptional strategic thinking ability with demonstrated success translating market opportunities into clear product vision and executable roadmaps

  • Customer-obsessed mindset with proven ability to deeply understand customer needs and translate them into compelling product experiences

  • Outstanding communication and influence skills, with ability to build consensus across functions and articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences

  • Data-driven approach to product development with experience establishing KPIs that directly correlate with customer business outcomes

  • Entrepreneurial mindset with high bias for action—comfortable operating in ambiguous environments while driving measurable results

  • Experience leading cross-functional teams through complex technical initiatives requiring coordination across multiple engineering disciplines

Req ID: J-654

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. If you require any accommodations for your interview or have any questions beforehand, rest assured that we will do everything we can to meet your needs. Visit Dandy Careers for more!

jobs.title: Head of People Systems
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

About the Role

At Dandy, we're reimagining the way People systems support people-first cultures. We’re looking for a Head of People Systems who’s excited to make an impact by optimizing how our teams access and interact with critical People tools. You’ll lead the charge on managing our HRIS platform (UKG), applicant tracking system (Ashby), driving innovation, and creating experiences that are efficient, seamless, and human-centered.

This is more than just a systems role — it’s a chance to shape how technology supports our people and culture as we scale.


What You'll Do

  • Own the administration and optimization of our People systems (UKG, Ashby, Lattice, TeamOhana) ensuring it runs smoothly and securely.

  • Serve as the technical expert across HRIS modules including Core HCM, Payroll, Benefits, Compensation, Absence, Time Tracking, Security, and Reporting.

  • Partner with People, Finance, and IT teams to gather requirements and deliver scalable solutions.

  • Drive automation and process improvements that reduce manual work and improve the employee experience.

  • Expand and enhance self-service capabilities for employees and managers, making information easier to find and use.

  • Lead system integrations, workflows, and configuration updates in alignment with business needs.

  • Manage, coach, and mentor a team of HRIS professionals to deliver quality results for our internal customers.

  • Drive the integration and successful adoption of new AI capabilities across People Systems, such as predictive analytics, intelligent automation, and generative AI tools, to optimize HR processes and self-service.


What We're Looking For

  • You have deep experience managing and optimizing HR systems, specifically UKG Pro and WFM (required).

  • You bring a strong understanding of HR operations, from hire to retire.

  • You’re tech-savvy and analytical — and you love turning data into insights and action.

  • You’ve worked with tools like Ashby, Deel, Lattice, or similar platforms and understand how they connect within the People tech ecosystem.

  • You’re a collaborative partner who communicates clearly and can explain complex topics to any audience.

  • You’re a self-starter who’s curious, solutions-focused, and always looking for ways to improve systems and processes.

Req ID: J-732

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

jobs.title: Director Advanced Manufacturing Engineering (AME), Removables
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

This role will lead the strategic vision, development, and execution of Dandy’s global manufacturing and automation roadmap for Removables product line. You will partner with leaders across product, engineering, operations, and supply chain to define and scale Dandy’s next-generation dental manufacturing systems.

You will be responsible for setting the strategic direction for the Removables manufacturing platform — leading teams that conceptualize, develop, and integrate automation systems to deliver exceptional quality, throughput, and cost efficiency. You will bridge the worlds of engineering, operations, product, and vendor partnerships, ensuring Dandy’s factories remain at the forefront of advanced manufacturing in the dental industry. This is a high-impact leadership role for a experienced manufacturing and automation executive who thrives at the intersection of technical excellence, strategic thinking, cross-functional collaboration.

What You’ll Do

Strategic Leadership & Vision

  • Define and execute the long-term Advanced Manufacturing & Automation strategy aligned with company objectives for scale, quality, and innovation.

  • Establish a multi-year technology roadmap for factory automation, digital manufacturing systems, and continuous improvement initiatives.

  • Partner with executive leadership to identify and prioritize key investments in automation, equipment, and process capabilities.

  • Drive the evolution of Dandy’s manufacturing operations toward world-class OEE, yield, and reliability benchmarks.

Cross-Functional Program Leadership

  • Act as the primary interface between Engineering, Operations, Product, and Quality teams for all advanced manufacturing initiatives.

  • Translate business and product needs into technical manufacturing strategies that balance innovation, scalability, and cost efficiency.

  • Oversee cross-functional project governance — driving alignment, risk mitigation, and timely execution across global teams.

  • Lead capital planning, program prioritization, and vendor strategy to ensure optimal ROI on manufacturing automation programs.

Technology & Process Development

  • Direct the design, validation, and integration of new automation systems and manufacturing technologies into Dandy’s factories.

  • Oversee the Advanced Manufacturing Engineering (AME) team, responsible for process innovation, equipment development, and lifecycle management.

  • Champion the adoption of data-driven manufacturing — integrating Industry 4.0 principles (IoT, predictive analytics, MES integration, digital twins).

  • Guide system design reviews, FAT/SAT protocols, and production qualification of new automation lines.

Organizational Development

  • Build and mentor a world-class team of automation engineers, program managers, and manufacturing leaders.

  • Foster a culture of innovation, accountability, and continuous improvement within the AME organization.

  • Represent the AME function in executive reviews, supplier negotiations, and industry forums.

What We’re Looking For

  • 15+ years of experience in Manufacturing Engineering and Automation with at least 5 years leading cross-functional teams at a Director level or above.

  • Proven experience developing and scaling automated manufacturing systems from concept to high-volume production.

  • Deep expertise in factory automation, process engineering, optical/mechanical systems, or precision assembly.

  • Experience with ceramics, CNC machining, spray applications, inkjet printing, etc.

  • Experience with plastics, 3D printing, thermoforming, injection molding, etc.

  • Demonstrated success in strategic planning, program portfolio management, and technology roadmapping.

  • Strong leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills — able to influence executives, engineers, and operations teams alike.

  • Background in regulated or precision industries (medical device, dental, optical, or semiconductor) is preferred.

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Industrial, or Manufacturing). MBA or equivalent strategic experience is a plus.

Why You’ll Love Working at Dandy

  • Drive innovation at the frontier of digital dentistry and advanced manufacturing.

  • Collaborate with an elite team of engineers, scientists, and operators passionate about redefining dental production.

  • Shape the strategy and systems that will power Dandy’s global manufacturing network for years to come.

  • Competitive compensation, equity, and benefits in a rapidly growing company redefining an industry.

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. If you require any accommodations for your interview or have any questions beforehand, rest assured that we will do everything we can to meet your needs. Visit Dandy Careers for more!

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Dental Product Marketing, Implants
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

At Dandy, we’re building the dental lab of the future. Our advanced medical device manufacturing and digital platform combine to make it simple for dentists to deliver high quality restorations, faster, easier, and more predictable than ever before. We’re looking for a Senior Product Marketing Manager to lead Implant Restorations at Dandy, including the launch of our first-ever All-on-X solution. This is a startup role in every sense: high-impact, high-visibility, and built for someone who’s hungry to make big things happen without waiting for a playbook.

About Dandy

Dandy is reimagining what a dental lab can be. By digitizing the entire process from scan to restoration, we’re helping thousands of dentists deliver better care with less hassle. Implants are one of the fastest-growing areas in dentistry, and we’re building the category-defining restorative solutions that will power the future of implant dentistry.

The Role

We’re looking for a curious, entrepreneurial, and driven PMM who thrives in fast-moving environments and loves solving hard problems. In this role, you’ll own how we define, position, launch, and grow Dandy’s implant restorative solutions — from single-unit implant crowns to full-arch restorations.

You’ll be the connective tissue between our practices, product, marketing, and commercial teams. Some days you’ll be in the weeds building a sales playbook or writing messaging + copy on an adoption campaign; other days you’ll be shaping strategy for a product launch that defines the future of the business. If you’re excited by ambiguity, move fast, and get energy from making things happen, you’ll love this role.

What You’ll Do

  • Be the voice of the customer: Spend time with GPs, understand their workflows, pain points, and aspirations around implants be it simple implant crowns or full All on X cases.

  • Own the narrative: Build positioning and messaging that makes Dandy’s implant offerings the obvious choice for practices.

  • Launch big things: Drive go-to-market strategy for new implant products including a new All-on-X solution and make them successful in the field.

  • Enable the team: Partner with enablement to build high-impact training that empowers sales, account management, and CX teams to win implant cases and support practices.

  • Iterate fast: Track adoption and feedback, experiment with new approaches, and move quickly to capture opportunities.

Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

At Dandy, we’re building the dental lab of the future. Our advanced medical device manufacturing and digital platform combine to make it simple for dentists to deliver high quality restorations, faster, easier, and more predictable than ever before. We’re looking for a Senior Product Marketing Manager to lead Implant Restorations at Dandy, including the launch of our first-ever All-on-X solution. This is a startup role in every sense: high-impact, high-visibility, and built for someone who’s hungry to make big things happen without waiting for a playbook.


ABOUT DANDY

Dandy is reimagining what a dental lab can be. By digitizing the entire process from scan to restoration, we’re helping thousands of dentists deliver better care with less hassle. Implants are one of the fastest-growing areas in dentistry, and we’re building the category-defining restorative solutions that will power the future of implant dentistry.


THE ROLE

We’re looking for a curious, entrepreneurial, and driven PMM who thrives in fast-moving environments and loves solving hard problems. In this role, you’ll own how we define, position, launch, and grow Dandy’s implant restorative solutions — from single-unit implant crowns to full-arch restorations.

You’ll be the connective tissue between our practices, product, marketing, and commercial teams. Some days you’ll be in the weeds building a sales playbook or writing messaging + copy on an adoption campaign; other days you’ll be shaping strategy for a product launch that defines the future of the business. If you’re excited by ambiguity, move fast, and get energy from making things happen, you’ll love this role.


WHAT YOU’LL DO

 - Be the voice of the customer: Spend time with GPs, understand their workflows, pain points, and aspirations around implants be it simple implant crowns or full All on X cases.

jobs.title: Enterprise Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

As we optimize our go-to-market strategy, we’ve segmented our sales approach into SMB and enterprise channels. As part of the founding Enterprise Account Executive Team, the ideal candidate will build, execute, and scale our efforts in our enterprise channel, with a focus on large group practices (approximately 10-150 locations). The Enterprise AE will focus on a land-and-expand, bottoms-up approach to account penetration in enterprise customers, focusing on accounts where Dandy has an initial footprint or master agreement. Most opportunities will be at the practice & regional levels, but will require a deep understanding of account dynamics to effectively win these high value customers.


What You'll Do

  • Qualify client leads through discovery calls

  • Identify and call prospective DSO to stimulate new client acquisition 

  • Serve as a key player and contributor to the direction of this growing sales team

  • Take a hybrid multi level selling approach to win large customers (both practice level and executive level selling required)

  • Meticulously track your sales activity using Salesforce and strive to exceed sales goals

  • Serve as a core stakeholder in defining the enterprise sales process for Dandy

  • Continuously think of yourself as a student of the dental industry and an expert on developing the Dandy value proposition for this segment

  • Work seamlessly with senior sales leadership to meet high-level KPIs and revenue targets


What We're Looking For

  • 5+ years of sales experience in a high-growth startup environment (SaaS work is highly preferred)

  • Deep experience closing deals (mid-market clients, and multi-level selling are a big plus)

  • Commitment to continuous improvement and desire to learn new sales concepts via rigorous trainings

  • Ability to navigate through ambiguity and ramp up quickly with limited resources 

  • Highly skilled and organized in Salesforce or related CRM

  • Overall track record of professional success


Bonus Points For

  • Relevant experience with a similar ICP (Dental/Private Practice Medical)

  • Experience with marketplace models

  • Love of blitz growth environments

  • Relentlessly positive attitude, strong sense of humor, and the ability to have fun at work

Req ID: J-568

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. If you require any accommodations for your interview or have any questions beforehand, rest assured that we will do everything we can to meet your needs. Visit Dandy Careers for more!

jobs.title: Clinical Field Trainer - West Coast
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

About the Role:

We’re looking for a highly consultative Multi Location Group Trainer, Bay Area West Coast to lead impactful, in-person training that accelerates early clinical success with Dandy’s digital dentistry solutions. This role is field-based, with up to 85% travel, and is focused on helping dental practices adopt intraoral scanning and digital workflows with confidence.

You’ll serve as a trusted clinical advisor to clinicians, operational leaders, and executive stakeholders—helping teams adopt new technology, digital workflows, improve clinical performance, and accelerate early success. This role combines clinical training expertise with operational execution and post-training insight to deliver measurable value at the intersection of training, technology, and practice growth.

What You’ll Do:

Training Delivery & Clinical Coaching

  • Lead high-touch, in-person trainings to support doctors and staff in adopting intraoral scanning and digital workflows.

  • Coach teams based on live observation, reinforcing best practices and adapting in real time to meet the practice’s goals and maturity level.

  • Drive early case submission during training by removing blockers, reinforcing clinical urgency, and building confidence during and immediately after training.

Clinical Advisory & Post-Training Analysis

  • Partner with clinicians and practice leaders to reinforce scanning habits and support early adoption.

  • Monitor outcomes in the first 30 days and surface targeted coaching opportunities to accelerate success.

  • Share field insights to inform scalable resources, improve onboarding, and strengthen future trainings.

Practice Readiness & Operational Alignment

  • Assess readiness across clinical workflows, team structure, and equipment to proactively surface blockers or risks.

  • Coordinate with internal teams to ensure the right resources, messaging, and tools are in place before training day.

  • Customize training strategies based on practice size, complexity, and clinical goals.


What We’re Looking For:

  • Clinical Training Experience: 3+ years of experience delivering clinical training in digital dentistry or dental technology, with strong familiarity with intraoral scanning and digital workflows. Should have experience training cohorts of up to ten assistants or staff at a time

  • Travel Readiness: Willingness and enthusiasm to travel up to 85% to deliver in-practice training and support.

  • Proximity to Travel Hubs: Located near a major airport (SFO) to support frequent national travel. Must be within 60-min drive to airport.

  • Leadership Presence: Comfortable partnering with senior leaders, clinicians, and staff across roles to influence behavior and drive adoption.

  • In-Person Agility: Comfortable operating independently in the field, adjusting plans in real-time based on practice dynamics and needs.

  • Operational Expertise: 3+ years managing training logistics, readiness assessments, and multi-practice coordination in fast-paced environments.

  • Strong Communicator: Excellent presentation and facilitation skills, with the ability to adjust tone and approach based on audience—whether working with hygienists or C-suite stakeholders.

Customer-Centric Mindset: Passion for helping practices succeed, with a solutions-oriented approach to onboarding, training, and adoption.

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. If you require any accommodations for your interview or have any questions beforehand, rest assured that we will do everything we can to meet your needs. Visit Dandy Careers for more!

  • Coach teams based on live observation, reinforcing best practices and adapting in real time to meet the practice’s goals and maturity level.

  • Drive early case submission during training by removing blockers, reinforcing clinical urgency, and building confidence during and immediately after training.

Clinical Advisory & Post-Training Analysis

  • Partner with clinicians and practice leaders to reinforce scanning habits and support early adoption.

  • Monitor outcomes in the first 30 days and surface targeted coaching opportunities to accelerate success.

  • Share field insights to inform scalable resources, improve onboarding, and strengthen future trainings.

Practice Readiness & Operational Alignment

  • Assess readiness across clinical workflows, team structure, and equipment to proactively surface blockers or risks.

  • Coordinate with internal teams to ensure the right resources, messaging, and tools are in place before training day.

  • Customize training strategies based on practice size, complexity, and clinical goals.


What We’re Looking For:

  • Clinical Training Experience: 3+ years of experience delivering clinical training in digital dentistry or dental technology, with strong familiarity with intraoral scanning and digital workflows. Should have experience training cohorts of up to ten assistants or staff at a time

  • Travel Readiness: Willingness and enthusiasm to travel up to 85% to deliver in-practice training and support.

  • Proximity to Travel Hubs: Located near a major airport to support frequent national travel. Must be within 60-min drive (JFK, EWR, LGA)

  • Leadership Presence: Comfortable partnering with senior leaders, clinicians, and staff across roles to influence behavior and drive adoption.

  • In-Person Agility: Comfortable operating independently in the field, adjusting plans in real-time based on practice dynamics and needs.

  • Operational Expertise: 3+ years managing training logistics, readiness assessments, and multi-practice coordination in fast-paced environments.

  • Strong Communicator: Excellent presentation and facilitation skills, with the ability to adjust tone and approach based on audience—whether working with hygienists or C-suite stakeholders.

Customer-Centric Mindset: Passion for helping practices succeed, with a solutions-oriented approach to onboarding, training, and adoption.

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. jobs.title: Manager of FP&A, Hardware
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

About the Role

We are seeking a strategic and hands-on Manager of FP&A, Hardware to lead financial planning, forecasting, and business partnering across Hardware and Hardware Programs. The ideal candidate has strong analytical capabilities, business acumen, and experience managing financial processes and teams in a fast paced, dynamic environment.

What You'll Do:

Financial Planning & Forecasting

  • Lead the annual budgeting and quarterly forecasting processes, ensuring accuracy, alignment, and timeliness.

  • Develop and maintain detailed financial models to support business planning and scenario analysis.

  • Collaborate with department heads to gather key assumptions and ensure cross-functional consistency.

Financial Analysis & Reporting

  • Analyze financial results, identifying trends, risks, and opportunities to improve financial performance.

  • Prepare monthly and quarterly management reports, including variance analysis and KPI dashboards.

  • Provide actionable insights and recommendations to senior leadership based on financial and operational data.

Inventory Management

  • Support long-term inventory tracking and forecasting for various hardware SKUs

  • Partner with fulfillment team to evaluate inventory levels and make decisions around purchases

  • Identify ways to streamline and automate ongoing inventory reporting and management

Qualifications

Education & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field (MBA, CFA or CPA preferred).

  • 5–8 years of progressive experience in FP&A, corporate finance, or related roles.

  • Experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.

  • Excellent modeling skills and proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets; Proficiency in financial systems (e.g., NetSuite, Anaplan, and AI-driven technology)

  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple priorities.

Req ID: J-755

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

jobs.title: Senior Technical Recruiter, Machine Learning
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

About the Role

We're looking for an exceptional Senior Technical Recruiter to focus exclusively on recruiting top-tier talent in Machine Learning (ML), Deep Learning, and Applied AI. This is a critical strategic role. You won't just fill requisitions; you'll be a talent strategist responsible for identifying, engaging, and assessing candidates who possess the deep technical expertise, first-principles thinking, and precision required to build and deploy novel AI solutions at scale.

Success in this role demands deep business and technical acumen. You must speak fluently about model architecture, research directions, and deployment challenges to earn credibility with both candidates and technical leadership.

What You'll Do

  • Act as Strategic Partner: Serve as a trusted, knowledgeable advisor to VPs of Engineering, ML Directors, and Research Leads, providing data-backed insights on market compensation, research trends, and hiring feasibility.

  • Operate on First Principles: Define roles based on first principles, including understanding the fundamental technical challenges the team needs to solve, rather than just filling a set of skills.

  • Communication: Maintain extremely high precision in communicating role requirements, team context, and candidate feedback, ensuring perfect alignment between technical leadership and the talent pipeline.

  • Technical Credibility: Utilize your deep technical acumen to craft personalized outreach and conduct initial technical screens that evaluate a candidate's research quality, contribution to papers (e.g., NeurIPS, ICML), and understanding of core ML concepts.

  • Ecosystem Mapping: Strategically map the talent landscape across top-tier academic institutions, research labs, and pioneering AI companies globally, building a long-term talent pipeline.

  • Quality & Bar-Raising: Champion a relentless focus on quality, ensuring every candidate presented raises the bar for technical excellence, rigor, and impact.

  • Interview Process Design: Partner with hiring managers to design and continuously refine a structured, predictive assessment process that accurately measures deep expertise in ML/AI.

  • Process Ownership: Own the full-cycle recruiting process for complex ML/AI roles, from initial contact to negotiation and closing.

  • Offer Negotiation: Lead sophisticated offer negotiations, requiring a nuanced understanding of market rates for highly specialized ML roles.

What You'll Bring

  • 5+ years of progressive experience in technical recruiting, with a minimum of 3 years dedicated to recruiting Machine Learning, AI, or Deep Learning research or software engineering talent in highly nuanced environments.

  • Technical acumen and an intellectual curiosity to credibly engage with senior ML professionals and understand the differences between various ML concepts.

  • Proven ability to assess talent based on the quality of their first-principles thinking and research contributions, not just years of experience.

  • Exceptional stakeholder management skills, with a track record of influencing senior technical leadership in a high-growth, high-bar environment.

  • A meticulous approach to work, emphasizing precision, rigor, and operational excellence in a complex hiring landscape.

Req ID: J-782

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. If you require any accommodations for your interview or have any questions beforehand, rest assured that we will do everything we can to meet your needs. Visit Dandy Careers for more!

jobs.title: Director of Operations, Provo
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

About the Role

We are looking for an experienced Director of Operations to oversee the end-to-end processes associated with manufacturing dental restorations (e.g., dentures, night guards), lead various cross-functional initiatives, ensure optimal use of equipment, and enforce quality & safety adherence. This role involves driving the development and scaling of new SKUs, which includes managing novel manufacturing processes in close partnership with our R&D department, as well as transitioning production from third-party providers to our state-of-the-art, digital-only facility.

This role will be onsite and located in Provo, Utah. However, Dandy will pay for a relocation for individuals who do not currently live in the area.

You will manage a team of 150+ technicians with varying levels of dental experience and have access to the latest technology to build out your team and drive optimization of both existing and new processes. You will be responsible for ensuring that orders are fabricated at the highest quality standards, meet customer deadlines, and achieve company-set financial targets. If you’re looking to disrupt an industry’s status quo, develop innovative manufacturing practices, and develop a team with aggressive growth targets, this is the right place for you!

What You'll Do

  • Drive results:

    • Own the site’s overall performance, including the successful development and production of new SKUs.

    • Set targets, drive execution, and hold the team accountable for meeting deadlines, quality standards, and hiring targets.

    • Manage labor and operating costs in alignment with budgets & strategic plans.

    • Drive standardization and scale-up initiatives to meet growing volume demands.

  • Lead new product integration:

    • Partner with R&D to ensure seamless implementation of new processes for innovative products.

    • Oversee the insourcing of production previously managed by third-party providers, ensuring efficient knowledge transfer and ramp-up.

    • Develop strategies for scaling production volumes while maintaining quality and efficiency.

  • Adapt to challenges:

    • Translate business goals from the Head of Manufacturing into actionable plans.

    • Leverage first-principle thinking to address complex challenges, particularly in the development of new workflows.

    • See problems and development areas as opportunities and foster an environment open to innovation.

    • Tackle change by leading with the “why” and inspiring buy-in & action at all levels.

  • Develop the team:

    • Coach and develop existing experts in the dental lab industry into leaders who will build and manage high performing teams.

    • Mentor and lead direct reports. Create a culture of regular coaching and professional development.

    • Work with Human Resources to continuously onboard, motivate, and develop employees in the most efficient & effective ways.

    • Motivate front line employees to see the big picture and provide daily feedback to guide them toward enabling the company’s vision.

What We're Looking For

  • 10-15 years of manufacturing experience, preferably currently holding a similar role in a manufacturing environment or having increasing management responsibility.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Manufacturing, or a related technical field from an accredited four-year institution.

  • Strong operational experience with scaling production processes and implementing new manufacturing workflows.

  • Experience collaborating with R&D or equivalent technical teams to integrate product innovations into operations.

  • Relentless drive for excellence and ability to create a culture that values high performance.

  • Excellent people manager who can motivate and create a positive employee experience.

  • Energizing leader who elevates the thinking and output of everyone around them.

  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

  • Proven analytical, evaluative and problem-solving abilities, with keen attention to detail.

    • Proficient with Excel or similar.

  • Is coachable - regularly solicits feedback from teammates above, below, and adjacent, and demonstrates agility by making clear behavioral changes.

  • Ability to be onsite at the facility daily Mon-Fri.

Bonus Points For

  • MBA or advanced degree.

  • Strong financial acumen.

  • Experience in insourcing or transitioning manufacturing processes.

  • Outstanding professional references to share.

  • APICS, CQE, Six sigma or Continuous Improvement credentials preferred.

  • Possess working knowledge of Lean Manufacturing techniques including: Kaizen, Value Stream Mapping, Kanban, Visual Management and JIT Lean manufacturing.

Req ID: J-775

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. If you require any accommodations for your interview or have any questions beforehand, rest assured that we will do everything we can to meet your needs. Visit Dandy Careers for more!

jobs.title: Instructional Designer, Provo
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dandy is transforming the massive and antiquated dental industry—an industry worth over $200B. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capital firms, we’re on an ambitious mission to simplify and modernize every function of the dental practice through technology. As we expand our reach globally, Dandy is building the operating system for dental offices around the world—empowering clinicians and their teams with technology, innovation, and world-class support to achieve more for their practices, their people, and their patients.

What We Are Looking For

Dandy is looking for an Instructional Designer and eLearning Developer to design and develop innovative learning solutions, including web-based training, software simulations, instructor-led sessions and experiential learning. You’ll use your instructional design and project management skills to create learning experiences that will reach a global team at Dandy. You will support both Dandy manufacturing teams as we grow the business and make the process repeatable and predictable.

What You’ll Do

  • Adhere to best in class instructional design processes informed by adult learning theory that produce engaging, high-quality materials

  • Conduct needs analyses of projects, audiences, learning objectives, and business goals

  • Collaborate with subject matter experts to design highly engaging and effective learning experiences

  • Work cross-functionally to project manage the end-to-end execution of multiple training initiatives simultaneously

  • Create engaging learning activities and compelling course content that enhances retention and transfer

  • Write and create engaging and exciting interactive eLearning modules and instructor-led courses

  • Assist in instructor-led training sessions, webinar facilitation, and video production for new product/solution launches

  • Curate content into meaningful learning paths

  • Monitor and drive engagement of our learning management system

  • Maintain current course materials in the LMS

  • Provide reporting and analysis on engagement and performance

  • Apply tested instructional design theories, practices and methods

  • Create supporting material/media (audio, video, simulations, role-plays, games, interviews, etc.)

  • Decide on the criteria used to judge learner’s performance and develop assessment instruments

  • Implement improvements in training curriculum and courseware using standard testing methods, needs analysis, and redesigning training programs


What We’re Looking for

  • 3+ years of experience in developing eLearning content, instructional design, and curriculum development

  • A high energy self-starter who works well in fast-paced environments with ability to manage multiple projects and drive them to a successful outcome while communicating issue/status to appropriate stakeholders

  • Demonstrated history of successfully working with SMEs and stakeholders to translate audience needs into effective training products

  • Ability to manage stakeholders’ expectations and communicate / organize project updates appropriately

  • Strong ability to write clear, concise documentation, and narration with an exceptional attention to detail

  • A highly organized autonomous innovator with top-notch project management, problem-solving, and communication skills

  • Ability to move quickly and pivot frequently

  • Experienced with Instructional Design and Rapid e-Learning Design methodologies, in order to help shape scripts and handle Instructional Design questions

  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team

  • Deep knowledge of adult learning theories, assessment and evaluation methods and industry best practices in facilitation, training, and blended learning solutions

  • Aptitude with aspects of course design, including animations, shapes, and image effects

  • Experience with one or more e-learning software tools (e. g. Storyline, Captivate)



Bonus Points For:

  • Outstanding professional references to share

  • Video content planning, shooting, and editing

  • Experience with Absorb LMS

  • Management consulting background

  • Experience in a fast-paced hyper-growth startup environment

  • Experience working with dental SMEs to create eLearning content around highly technical topics

  • Relentlessly positive attitude, strong sense of humor, and the ability to have fun at work

What We Offer:

By joining Dandy, you will be part of a young, creative and dynamic company undergoing rapid growth and transformation into a global market leader.

  • Competitive salary

  • Meaningful equity compensation

  • All the computer gear you need to improve your productivity

  • Work-life flexibility - we value your contributions above all!

  • Flexible PTO

Req ID: J-749

For full-time positions, Dandy offers a wide range of best-in-class, comprehensive, and inclusive benefits tailored to each country where we operate. Our local benefits packages typically include healthcare, dental, mental health support, parental planning resources, retirement savings options, and generous paid time off—ensuring our team members are supported no matter where they live and work.

Dandy is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity to win as one. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, citizenship or immigration status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

Dandy also fully complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). We are dedicated to embracing challenges and creating an accessible, inclusive workplace for all individuals. If you require any accommodations for your interview or have any questions beforehand, rest assured that we will do everything we can to meet your needs. Visit Dandy Careers for more!
